captions.text: You've felt it your entire life
that there is something wrong with the world.
You don't know what it is, but it's there
like a splinter in your mind
driving you mad.
Do you know what I'm talking about?
The Matrix
The Matrix is everywhere.
It is all around us.
Even now, in this very room.
You can see it when you look out your window
or when you turn on your television.
You can feel it when you go to work
when you go to church
when you pay your taxes.
It is the world that has been pulled over your eyes
to blind you from the truth.
What truth?
That you are a slave Neo.
Like everyone else you were born into bondage
born into a prison
that you cannot smell or taste or touch.
A prison for your mind.
Deep inside you have always known the truth.
That none of this has to be this way.
That there is more to life than what we've been told.
That your life has a greater purpose.
You are here to wake up.

title: You've Felt It Your Entire Life

comments.text:
+rpare666 That is debatable but the actuality of the number of the beast is 
meaningless in this instance anyway. about 99.99% of everyone in the world 
associate the number 666 with the devil, with evil, with rebellion and 
degeneracy. 616 would just be another number to most. you chose 666 for 
effect, to push that message of godlessness, nihilism and rebellion. to 
represent, likened to that of a gang. its representative of your belief and 
nature you chose to embrace. its so interesting you mix in love with your 
atheistic nihilistic viewpoint. you cannot do so and you're a hypocrite for 
doing so by the way. love does not exist under such an ideology. its a mere 
fabrication. Illusions, Mr. Anderson, vagaries of perception, temporary 
constructs of a feeble human intellect trying desperately to justify an 
existence that is without meaning or purpose! to quote one of my favorite 
movies lol. you see? you are agent smith, i am neo lol.
I neither love nor hate this world in entirety. i love it and i hate it. 
this world is both good and bad and everything in between. theres a song i 
like that goes "i love this crazy tragic, sometimes almost magic, awful, 
beautiful life", because its so true and sums up how i feel about this 
world. i dont expect to be raptured anywhere or taken to some wispy 
fairytale like heaven in the clouds with harps, naked babies with wings and 
translucent disembodied spirits. most people have a misperception of what 
heaven is. heaven is a reformation of this world, a return to original 
intent and free from all those bad things that fall under the religious 
umbrella term sin that came as a product of the free will of desired 
sentient beings. so it will be all those good things i love about this 
world, about life, about existance and the joy of creation without all the 
bad things i hate about this world. it will be that and a whole lot more.
comments.author: kingdomwithin1

comments.text:
